item.description:
Update: Since it's raining, Iron Horse will have a place for us inside their store. We will meet inside the store from 1-4pm. They need to close up at 4pm to clean up. See you soon! Sandra

 

World Wide Knit in Public Day (WWKPD) was started in 2005 by Danielle Landes and takes place on the second Saturday of June each year. It began as a way for knitters to come together and enjoy each others company.

Knit in Public Day is unique, in that it's the largest knitter run event in the world. Each local event is put together by a volunteer or a group of volunteers. They each organize an event because they want to, not because they have to. They bring their own fresh ideas into planning where the event should be held, and what people would like to do.

Iron Horse knitting store couldn't get it together in time to make it an "official" event as you will not see the event on their website or the WWKPD website. I've contacted the owner and she will hold an informal event. Feel free to come early as Natick has their Farmer's Market event on the center green. You can also check out Iron Horse's shop.

Iron Horse said that they will provide chairs, however, I plan on bringing my own chair just in case there's not enough.
item.why: Note: Due to a few members who wanted to join this event at Iron Horse in Natick, MA, we're changing the location of our meetup and holding it an hour early. I'm sorry to those who were counting on coming into Westborough!
item.name: Celebrating "World Wide Knitting in Public" day!
